content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.

entries.title: How to Get Live Captions For Any Video or Audio in Chrome

The "Live Caption" feature is built into the Google Chrome browser and works everywhere. We'll show you how to use this handy feature. Google Chrome itself can create captions for any video or audio-only content playing in the web browser.

entries.title: OBS Studio
ENCO Introduces Raptor Cloud-Based Captioning For Live Streaming Video
entries.snippet:
ENCO has announced the release of Raptor, a cloud-based live streaming captioning encoder, designed to provide real-time AI-driven captioning for IP video streams. Introduced at IBC2025, Raptor allows seamless embedding of CEA-608 closed captions into live video without the need for physical hardware, aligning with the industry-wide shift to cloud-based workflows. Built on a fully software-defined architecture, Raptor supports video inputs via SRT, RTMP, or HLS and can be hosted on public or private clouds, enabling flexible caption insertion at nearly any point in a video stream.

Raptor leverages ENCO’s enCaption AI technology for automatic, high-accuracy caption generation and also supports integration with other cloud-based captioning services. It ensures compatibility with enTranslate for multilingual translation and includes features like customizable word libraries, speaker identification, and detection of non-verbal audio cues like music or crowd noise. Designed for ease of deployment, Raptor promises a cost-effective, agile solution ideal for live events, according to ENCO President Ken Frommert.

entries.title: Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Save $300 on AI caption and transcription platform Joyspace, now $79.99
entries.snippet:
The article promotes a significant discount on a lifetime subscription to Joyspace, an AI-powered captioning and transcription platform, now available for $79.99 (originally $379). Joyspace allows users to automatically generate captions for videos and transcribe recordings or podcasts using AI. With the Essential Plan, subscribers receive 80 minutes of transcription and 160 credits per month, as well as a 45-minute video export limit.

The plan also includes features such as watermark-free video, downloadable transcripts, instant captions, unlimited downloads and templates, and access to B-roll media like images and GIFs. Supporting 35 languages, Joyspace makes it easy to work with multi-lingual content without needing bilingual services. The platform allows customization of captions to match brand aesthetics and offers tools like animated emojis and timing adjustments for readability.

Beyond accessibility for the hearing-impaired, captions support silent viewing and content virality. Joyspace aims to streamline content creation for webinars, podcasts, and videos, helping creators maximize reach and user engagement.

entries.title: MeetDot: Videoconferencing with Live Translation Captions
Android Is Now Using AI to Upgrade Your Phone's Closed Captions
entries.snippet:
Google is enhancing Android and Pixel devices with new features, prominently including AI-powered accessibility upgrades. The standout update is the introduction of "Expressive Captions," an enhancement to the Live Caption feature, which now includes descriptors for tone and non-verbal sounds like [sighs], [gasps], and [APPLAUSE], all processed locally without requiring cloud access. These improvements cater especially to deaf and hard-of-hearing users, and work across various apps, including during video calls.

Additional improvements include AI-driven image descriptions in the Lookout app for users with low vision, now powered by Gemini 1.5 Pro. Gemini’s integration with third-party apps expands its functionality, such as controlling Spotify, smart devices, and camera functions. Google is also rolling out smarter document scanning in Drive, a simpler sharing method via QR codes through Quick Share, and user-tailored AI responses via “Saved info with Gemini.”

For Pixel phones, enhanced features include a more interactive Call Screen, audio clean-up tools in the Recorder app, improved song recognition with Now Playing, new theft protection via Identity Check, and systemwide UI and usability improvements. Pixel Watch and Fitbit users also benefit from expanded access to health-tracking features like Daily Readiness and Cardio Load.

v.title: Multimodal Matching Transformer for Live Commenting
LiveBot: Generating Live Video Comments Based on Visual and Textual Contexts
LiveStar: Live Streaming Assistant for Real-World Online Video Understanding
Brightcove Unveils New AI Features
v.snippet:
Brightcove has announced the release of seven new AI-powered features aimed at expanding global access, increasing engagement, enhancing live-streaming quality, and optimizing video workflows. These updates are part of a larger rollout of 12 tools introduced recently, and nearly 150 customers are already testing the new capabilities. A major highlight is the upgraded AI Suite, including a Universal Translator that supports video localization in over 50 languages and offers refined dubbing options such as synthetic and speaker-modeled voices. 

The Auto-Captions feature now offers greater accuracy and customization through the addition of a brand-sensitive dictionary. Another notable tool, Metadata Optimizer, enhances searchability and SEO by analyzing text, audio, and visuals, with support for over 40 languages. 

For mobile engagement, a new Vertical Videos gallery template enables swipeable video feeds on company websites. Also, the NextGen Live upgrade brings 4K UHD streaming, low-latency (as little as 8 seconds), and a unified system for live streaming, ad insertion, and content protection—enhancing quality, security, and monetization potential.

v.title: How to Use Hulu Subtitles
v.snippet: This document provides a comprehensive guide on how to enable and disable subtitles or closed captions on Hulu across various platforms. It outlines the step-by-step process for accessing subtitle settings on Hulu's website, the mobile app (iOS and Android), streaming devices (like Apple TV, gaming consoles, Chromecasts), and older devices using the classic Hulu app. To activate subtitles on the Hulu website, users can access the settings gear while playing a video, then navigate to the subtitle menu to select language and style. On mobile devices, similar settings are found in the playback screen. Streaming devices may vary slightly, but generally involve navigating through a settings menu with a remote. In older versions of the Hulu app, subtitle options appear under playback settings. The article also explains how to turn off subtitles by selecting “Off” in the subtitle menu. Subtitles are currently available in English and Spanish, depending on the content. Additionally, the document addresses related issues like fixing audio sync problems and changing audio language during playback.

**On your computer:**

- **Chrome** → Settings → Advanced → Accessibility → Live Captions (or right-click media bar

). citeturn0search5
